required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on December 16, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Study on Avatrombopag for the Promotion of Platelet Engraftment After Allo-HSCT
clinical_study.official_title: Avatrombopag vs Recombinant Human Thrombopoietin to Enhance Platelet Engraftment After Allogeneic Hematopoietic Stem Cell Transplantation

lead_sponsor.agency: The First Affiliated Hospital of Soochow University

clinical_study.source: The First Affiliated Hospital of Soochow University

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of the study is to evaluate the efficacy and safety of avatrombopag in the treatment of thrombocytopenia after Allo-HSCT.

detailed_description.textblock: Patients with thrombocytopenia after allogenic hematopoietic stem cell transplantation (Allo-HSCT) who meet Eligibility Criteria were randomly assigned into the avatrombopag group and the rhTPO treatment group(standard group) with 1:1 ratio. The study is divided into two stages, including 4-weeks' core study and 4-weeks' extended study.

primary_outcome.measure: Percentage of participants whose PLT reaches ≥ 20*109/L without the need for PLT transfusion.
primary_outcome.description: Percentage of participants whose PLT reaches ≥ 20*109/L without the need for PLT transfusion for consecutive 7 days during core study.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of participants whose PLT reaches ≥ 20*109/L without the need for PLT transfusion.
secondary_outcome.description: Percentage of participants whose PLT reaches ≥ 20*109/L without the need for PLT transfusion for consecutive 7 days during extended study.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of participants without PLT response
secondary_outcome.description: Percentage of participants without PLT response in the standard group but with PLT reconstruction after receiving avatrombopag.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of participants with PLT≥ 50*109/L without the need of PLT transfusion
secondary_outcome.description: Percentage of participants with PLT≥ 50*109/L without the need of PLT transfusion for consecutive 7 days during the core and extended study.

secondary_outcome.measure: The time to achieve PLT ≥ 20*109/L without the need of PLT transfusion
secondary_outcome.description: The time to achieve PLT ≥ 20*109/L without the need of PLT transfusion for consecutive 7 days in both group.

secondary_outcome.measure: Proportion of participants achieving platelet reconstitution
secondary_outcome.description: Proportion of participants achieving platelet reconstitution after 4 weeks of drug withdrawal.

clinical_study.condition: PLT After Allogenic Hematopoietic Stem Cell Transplantation

arm_group.description: In the 4-weeks' core study,the initial dose of avatrombopag is 20 mg/d. If the patient's PLT count remains less than 20*109/L after one week, the maximum dose was increased to 40 mg/d. Avatrombopag will be taken orally with food;in the 4-weeks' extended study,participants in the avatrombopag group who does not meet the withdrawal indication can be enrolled in the extended study and continue the avatrombopag treatment with a maximum dose of 60 mg/d.
In the 4-weeks' core study,the rhTPO will be subcutaneously injected with dosage of 300 U/kg/d.

intervention.description: Participants are randomly assigned into the avatrombopag group and the rhTPO treatment group(standard group) with 1:1 ratio. The initial dose of avatrombopag is 20 mg/d. If the patient's PLT count remains less than 20*109/L after one week, the maximum dose was increased to 40 mg/d. Avatrombopag will be taken orally with food.
Participants are randomly assigned into the avatrombopag group and the rhTPO treatment group(standard group) with 1:1 ratio.The rhTPO will be subcutaneously injected with dosage of 300 U/kg/d;

overall_official.affiliation: The First Affiliated Hospital of Soochow University

provided_document.document_type: Study Protocol, Statistical Analysis Plan, and Informed Consent Form
